scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-219 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-219 is a star with 1.17 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.49 times its radius. It is located 2567.08 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-219 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-219 system


Kepler-219 b

Kepler-219 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2014-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-219 b is 8.999 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-219 b is 2.950 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-219 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


Kepler-219 c

Kepler-219 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2014-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.17 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-219 c is 12.529 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-219 c is 3.580 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-219 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


Kepler-219 d

Kepler-219 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2014-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.27 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-219 d is 19.080 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-219 d is 2.810 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-219 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-219, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the Kepler.
name: Kepler-219 - System With 3 Exolanets
